qas.question: The Haunted Mansion at Disneyland in California and the one in Paris, France sharewhat attribute?
What is the name of area that is really an elevator?
What is included in the elevator's design?

answers.text: The elevator has no ceiling and its shaft is decorated to look like walls of a mansion

qas.question: What is the illusion given by these effects?

answers.text: the illusion of the room stretching

context: Part of the Haunted Mansion attraction at Disneyland in Anaheim, California, and Disneyland in Paris, France, <a0_0>takes place on an elevator<a0_0/>. <a1_0>The "stretching room"<a1_0/> on the ride is actually an elevator that travels downwards, giving access to a short underground tunnel which leads to the rest of the attraction. <a2_0>The elevator has no ceiling and its shaft is decorated to look like walls of a mansion<a2_0/>. Because there is no roof, passengers are able to see the walls of the shaft by looking up, which gives <a3_0>the illusion of the room stretching<a3_0/>.
